text: hi welcome to the episode of our video
series where you can meet women in the
solutions architect role at Amazon web
services understand more about their job
role and also dive into some of the
technical use cases that has helped
different businesses in their Cloud
journey I am sujata I am an Enterprise
Solutions architect at Amazon web
services within AWS there are various
Solutions architect roles such as
specialist essays we have partner essays
and we have account ESS is so I am an
account Solutions architect and my job
role is to work closely with our
customers and help them in their Cloud
journey to AWS particularly focusing on
technical aspects such as Cloud
migration modernization providing
architectural reviews and
recommendations and I also help our
customers understand the art of possible
by leveraging the AWS services and
solutions I also support our customers
team through technical Deep dive
sessions proof of Concepts demos and
Hands-On
workshops so I primarily work with the
cpg industries for those unfamiliar cpg
or the consumer packaged goods are those
who manufacture and sell everyday
consumer products like food um beverages
Personal Care items household cleaners
and other consumable Goods which are
primarily sold through the retail
channel so in this video today I'm going
to take you through a common problem or
a common use case which I have seen in
the cpg industry however this is a use
case which is relevant across many other
Industries so the primary challenge
which I have seen talking to our
customers is lack of accuracy in the
sales forecasting process which means
that businesses who make these products
they often have a hard time
understanding or predict in the future
demand of their
products and when the demand forecasting
is
inaccurate it can lead to two major
problems the first one is access
inventory which means that companies end
up producing and storing more products
than their actual customer demand and
this can lead to Warehouse concession or
overcrowding of the warehouses and this
can also halt the production
because of the unavailability of storage
for the finished
goods the other challenge can be just
the opposite which is stock out risk and
this is where businesses they will not
have enough of the products in stock to
meet their customers demand and in both
of these situations it can lead to loss
of Revenue it can impact to the
business so while we know that sales
forecasting is such an important use
case there are multiple products there
are multiple methods already available
in the market to generate the forecast
but the problem is most of these
products or most of these methods they
make use of traditional methods and
these traditional methods they either
make use of statistical model or
classical machine learning model which
comes with certain set of
limitations such as most of these
methods they rely completely on the
historical data to predict the future
data point however in real world there
are a lot of other complexities there
are a lot of existing demand signals
that can influence these forecasting
landscape and these traditional methods
are unable to use those for an example
most of them do not handle seasonality
very well so the product demand can go
up it can go down based on certain
seasons based on holidays
uh based on certain events or promotions
and if the forecasting model is unable
to consider these important factors then
the forecasting accuracy can be
compromised the another challenge is
even though businesses they want to
improve the forecasting accuracy they do
not have in-house experts in the team
they do not have data scientists they do
not have machine learning experts who
can actually Implement and Main maintain
these Advanced forecasting
Solutions so when we speak to our
customers we often see that they are
looking for a solution which can improve
the sales forecasting accuracy without
having any specialized skills or without
providing any extensive training for
their team
members so in this video today I'm going
to take you through some of the AWS
services that can be used to address
this issue and meet our customers
requirement so the primary service which
I'm going to talk today is Amazon Sage
maker canvas so sagemaker canvas
provides a completely no code visual
interface where anybody in the
organization they can build and train
their machine learning models and
generate the ml based predictions
without writing any code and without
having any machine learning
experience Sage maker canvas also makes
it easier to collaborate with your
machine learning experts so even if you
have data scientists in the team the
business analyst they can still make use
of canvas they can build and train their
models and they can easily share the
code generated by canvas to The Experts
who can then review the code they can
provide the feedback and also they can
deploy this model as a part of the
existing mlops workflow
in terms of pricing canvas is based on
uses based pricing so you don't have to
go through any long-term licensing cost
you only pay for what you
use we also have recently added
generative AI capabilities to Canvas now
which means that you can access ready to
use Foundation models for use cases such
as Q&A on top of your Enterprise
knowledge base or text summarization
content the generation and so on so
overall there are a lot of problem types
which can be solved using canvas but
today's focus is going to be on time
series analysis and demand
forecasting the other AWS service which
can be used in addition to Canvas is
Amazon quick site so Amazon quick site
is a seress business intelligence
service that empowers everyone in the
organization to access and analyze the
data in the format they
prefer quick site also enables automated
argumented analytics using machine
learning insights and natural language
queries allowing the end users to
effortlessly gain insights from their
data and now we have made Amazon quick
site much more simpler and easier to use
by adding generative bi capabilities
this means that quicksite users can now
create the visuals using natural
language descriptions and they can also
ask questions in natural language
queries and this accelerates the path to
datadriven decision making for all the
users so now I've have discussed about
the services now let's see how we can
bring this workflow to
life so this workflow demonstrates how
you can make use of canvas to build an
endtoend machine learning workflow right
from data preparation to data ingestion
training your model generating your
predictions abstracting away all the
technical complexities and allowing you
to focus just on your business
goals so the first step in building a
custom model is to prepare your data so
canvas provides around 50 plus built-in
connectors to different data sources
where you can easily connect to your
data source and you can retrieve R the
data to train your
models so for example in this use case
you can retrieve the historical sales
demand from your data source and train
your models and inside of canvas if you
want to perform any kind of data
cleansing if you want to do any kind of
data transformation you can do so right
from the canvas UI
interface now once the data is prepared
now canvas takes care of all the heavy
lifting
so you don't have to worry about uh
which algorithms I should use to train
my models Which models I should use so
canvas is going to make use of AWS
automl Innovation and it will do all
kind of feature engineering uh model
selection hyperparameter optimization so
basically it will train and test
multiple machine learning models at the
back end and it will pick up the most
optimized model for you which provides
you the best accurate
results so now once your model is
trained you can generate the prediction
using the model and you can send these
predictions to Amazon quick site for
visualization and accelerated decision
making so now let's discuss the high
level architecture it is very very
simple because that's what our customers
have been asking for so using the canvas
UI inter face you can make use of the
canvas connectors to connect to your
different data sources like if you have
any SAS applications you can also upload
the file from your local machine or you
can connect to different AWS services
and other databases and once the data is
imported inside of canvas you can join
the data sets you can cleanse the data
you can do the Transformations and from
there you can make use of AWS automl
capability to train the models once the
model is trained you can then send the
predictions to Amazon quick site so the
benefit of this architecture is that it
provides a streamlined endtoend no code
Predictive Analytics solution without
you having to build a complex data
pipeline or a model deployment
infrastructure so now as I've worked you
through the uh overview of the different
Services now let's jump into the quick
demo and see how it works in action so
this is the canvas UI interface and it
can be accessed from the AWS console or
it can also be accessed using single
sign on experience right outside the AWS
console making it much more business
user friendly so you can see we have
options to build a custom model we can
also access ready to use Foundation
models for generative AI use cases and
we also have the other ready to use

build a custom model using our own data
for this
demo so the first step to create a
custom model is to create a data set so
I'll go on data
sets and I'll will import the
data go on
Create and now on the data source as you

S3 which is our data Lake snowflake

different other set of connectors as
well so for this demo I will uh use

that now select the
files and I'll choose the sample data
set
and now I can preview this data set so
as you can see uh this data set contains
the historical time series data for
different consumer items I have used
item name uh to make it easier to
understand but you can use SKU or any
other unique identifier for your item uh
I have used store ID which is an
optional
column time stamp and historical demand
and price so you can use other

Etc what what other attributes you want

training
process and then I'll create the data

changed to processing the data is
getting
imported now the data is
imported I will use this data set now to

there are different options in our use
case it will be predictive analysis
because this is a Time series
forecasting problem and I want to
predict the item demand so I'll click on
Create and now I will select a Target
column or the column which I want to
predict so I want to predict the demand
of the item so my target column is
demand so now as you can see as soon as
I've selected the target column canvas
is automatically recommending the
appropriate model type so it has
identified that this is a Time series
forecasting use case based on my data
set and now I can configure this
model now I will choose the unique
identifier for each of my item so I have
item id as my unique identifier so I
will choose item
ID I can also choose a grouping column
which is optional but I will use store
ID as the grouping column because I want
to predict the demand based on item and
store so store ID is the grouping
column I can choose the column that
contains the
timestamps and I can specify the number
of months I want to forecast in the
future So based on the granularity of
your data set you will have options to
forecast for days weeks and so on so I
put five what you will see here is
canvas also provides an inbuilt holiday
data set so if your demand is impacted
by holidays you can enable this holiday
data set for improving your prediction
accuracy so it's very simple you can
simply enable holiday schedule and you
can choose the country I will not be
using it for this
demo and then I'll click on
Save and then I can click on standard
build because I want to build a highly
performant model so as you can see as
soon as I've clicked the standard build
canvas is validating the data at the
back end so it will check for any kind
of missing values or if there is
anything in the data set which can go
wrong such as if the time series data
has any missing data points and so on
and once the valid is done canvas will
kick off the automl process at the back
end so as you can see typical Standard
Time to finish this is between 1 to 4
hours here the expected Bild time is 2
hours so I've already created a model
beforehand so let's see how it looks
like once the model is trained so I'll
go on my models and this is my trained
model so as you can see once the
training is done canvas will provide the
accuracy metrics so I have different set
of accuracy metrics which I can validate
it also provides the column impact uh
for example in this use case price has
greatest impact on the forecasted value
and once I'm happy with this uh metrics
I can now use this model to generate my
predictions so I'll go on predict under
predict I have two options I can go for
batch prediction where I can predict the
demand for all of the items in my data
set or I can go for single prediction
where I can predict the demand for
single item so let's go on single
prediction
first and I can choose the item ID for
which I want to generate the uh
predictions so say I want to predict the
demand for audio cookies and store a for
the next five months because that's what
I've configured the model
for and now here I have the forecast
ready so what you will see here is
canvas does not provide a single value
forecast but it provides a range of
values and we call these prediction
quantiles so what does that mean so P90
means 90% confidence that the actual
value will be less than the predicted
value 90% of the time which means you
have 90% confidence of meeting your
demand whereas p50 means 50% confidence
that the actual value will be less than
the predicted value 50% of the time and
this is how canvas gives you the
flexibility to choose the right
forecasted values based on your
different items and based on your
different use case uh for example for
high selling products I never want to go
out of stock so I can choose P90 and for
rest of the items I might go for p50 so
you have that kind of flexibility to
choose the different forecast
values the next thing which I wanted to
show is what if scenario and this is
when our customers want to understand
the impact of the different factors on
their demand uh for an example in this
use case I want to understand that if I
lower the price of this item how is it
going to impact my demand so for example
if I lower the price to
50 how is my demand going to get
impacted and now you will see here that
canvas has given you a secondary
scenario so you had the P10 p50 P90
earlier but now you also have a
secondary scenario with the price
change and this is how uh the users they
can uh make business decisions they can
make future planning based on their
understanding on the impact of the
different factors
now I will go to batch
